author: Tyler Schumacher
text: 'Waited over an hour for a delivery only for the pizza to be so cold it wasn‚Äôt safe to eat. Also was burnt and charred to begin with. Offered to make us another pizza but it‚Äôd be another hour. Absolute clown show they‚Äôre operating
column5: will never order from here again.'

text: 'Pizza is awesome but when you say your going to text someone when it‚Äôs ready and it‚Äôs going to take an hour. You should make sure you do it. I‚Äôll review again when this issue is fixed. Great place though.'

text: 'Pay twice what it costs at other pizza places...but the pizza is great. Wait one hour for pick up pizza...but the pizza is great.  They completely mess up the pizza you order...one too far.  Pizza is really good

author: Diana Arce
text: 'The pizza was delicious but we waited 1 hour and 30 minutes for it. It was my first time there and I really wanted to try the pizza but I think it is not worth it.\nThe meatballs were delicious but a little overprice.\nIt seems that they are better with take out so if you want to try it better to order pick up instead of waiting over an hour for your pizza to get to your table.'

author: High Virtue
text: 'All the people leaving negative reviews are childish and spoiled babies. I eat here often and the services and food is always amazing.'

author: Kayla R
text: 'Perfectly crispy pizza every time and the red sauce is sweet and tangy. Removed one star because they don‚Äôt deliver. I would order here more often if delivery was available. Usually drive 25 mins each way for this pizza and it‚Äôs still worth it.'

author: Jay
text: "Easily one of the best pizzas I've had in New York or New Jersey. I just wish they delivered
column5: I would eat from there far more often."

author: Daniel deCavaignac
text: 'Love the pizza.  It doesn‚Äôt deliver well because the thin crust gets soggy but at the restaurant
column5: the pizza is best in Hoboken.  Only problem
column6: and it‚Äôs not insignificant
column7: are the prices.   2 two topping pizzas and a bottle of water was $83.    It‚Äôs a night out
column8: not a quick pizza.'

author: Rachel Rowan
text: 'I think they have the best chicken parm in town. We first ordered it as delivery
column5: which was good and on time. So we went tonight to try their chicken parm in person and again it was delicious. We also got the bruschetta too and while each ingredient was fresh and delicious
column6: it was a little hard to eat because the tomatoes were cut too large so they kept falling off the bread.\n\nDining in was great but a little weird in that they don‚Äôt serve drinks? We ordered water and got handed bottled water..? I asked if they had iced tea
column7: but they were ‚Äúout of Snapple‚Äù ‚Äî not what I had in mind. For a place that clearly cares so much about their food being of the highest quality
column8: I can‚Äôt figure out why they wouldn‚Äôt finish off the dining experience by actually offering drinks to go with their amazing food. Otherwise loved the atmosphere inside and the server was fine if not a bit disinterested.'

author: Jennifer Sullivan
text: 'Takeout is always very slow
column5: but I\'ve had experiences where they say the food will be ready in a half hour and it takes more than an hour.  If it\'s going to be an hour
column6: tell me when I order it so I can either say "no thanks" or plan accordingly.'

author: Mauro Briceno
text: 'Too Overpriced
column5: and very slow service. However the Pizza
column6: the meat balls and the burrata are delicious. But honestly they take foooooreeeeeveeeeer!!!\n\nA burrata
column7: a pizza a salad and meatballs
column8: were $100+ (without alcohol).\n\nThe decoration inside it‚Äôs too simple
column11: I‚Äôm May not go back there‚Ä¶. And if I do
column12: ir will be because of the meatballs!!!\n\nGood luck !'

author: Meet Patel
text: "The plain pie made thin and crispy with their special garlic
column5: pepper oil is absolutely some of the best pizza I've ever had! This was our first stop in a short pizza tour with friends and we unanimously agreed that it was the bes pizza we had that day! Ralph's in Nutley
column6: NJ was a close second but the combination of garnish
column7: flavor
column8: crisp
column9: and the added bonus of the oil made this place the clear winner! The pizza is definitely pricey at $25 for a pie but I think its worth treating yourself once in a while!"

author: meg carlson
text: 'Amazing pie
column5: if it‚Äôs pay day.'

author: Jonathan Pepe
text: "The food is what you're coming for
column5: it's so #$%& good. I mean
column6: is 38 dollars outrageous for a pizza served to you by a 16 year old who's never worked as a server before? Yes. But come on! This pizza takes me right back to Carroll Gardens in the 80s. The salads are a rip off
column7: but virtually everything else with red sauce on it is great. Pastas are nice too. BYOB which is a nice value add."

author: Junieth Orellana
text: 'AMAZING
column5: THE BEST PIZZA IN Hoboken.'

author: Matthew L. Cohen
text: 'Good food
column5: but overpriced and terrible service.\n\nTakeout is always very slow
column6: but I\'ve had experiences where they say the food will be ready in a half hour and it takes more than an hour.  If it\'s going to be an hour
column7: tell me when I order it so I can either say "no thanks" or plan accordingly.\n\nLast night we decided to try eating at the restaurant
column8: thinking that would avoid the long wait for takeout.  It still took about an hour.  This was because our waiter forgot to enter our ticket before leaving for the night.  Another attentive staff member noticed my wife and I slowly dying of hunger
column10: and put our order in and apologized.  He didn\'t explain what happened though until I mentioned that I was confused that other tables sat down 15 minutes after us and got pizza before us.  Which is fine
column11: it happens.  But there\'s a pattern.  And a well-run business would have compensated us in some way.  "Sorry the kitchen messed up
column12: here\'s a dessert on us" for example.  That didn\'t happen.'

author: Lori Parks
text: 'Thin
column5: crispy perfection!'

author: Calvin M
text: "Wow it's one of the best. üôåüôå"

author: Melinda Martinez
text: 'Absolutely amazing'

author: Hansel Cabrera
text: 'Good crispy pizza'

author: keith roach
text: "Awesome pie!!!!!  Love this place wish I didn't live so far.  Me and my crew working in the tunnel at Amtrak love this pie"

author: Matthew Logan
text: 'Either them or Napoli‚Äôs is the best in Hoboken. I‚Äôm pretty sure I‚Äôve been to all the pizza places in Hoboken. There‚Äôs a lot.'

author: Preston Frankel
text: "Great Work the super crunchy crust and dough. Also very good price for this pizza. The cheese is so good.  Its like the best pizza iv'e had like that homemade cheese yum"

text: 'DELICIOUS  !!!!'

text: 'THE BEST PIZZA AROUND TOWN! Worth the $ - all the food is really good. No complaints at all.'

author: John Cardin
text: 'Really good pizza. Definitely recommend it to any real pizza lover'

author: David Edwards
text: "Authentic Italian pizza and more.  I saw some of the reviews where people complained they thought the pizza was burnt... Not true.  This is authentic Italian pizza and comes out exactly as it should.   Also the Cacio and Pepe is amazing.  It‚Äôs as good as dishes I've eaten in Italy!!   Great place!"

author: Kaitlyn Conway
text: "I just got back from driving 20 minutes into hoboken to pick up a square bufala mutz pie and unfortunately left no with pizza. When I arrived I was told by an employee that my pizza separated and opened the box to show me. There was sauce all over the box
column5: the crust was completely burnt
column6: and the cheese had fallen off. I asked if I could have a new one and the employee spoke with the cook and showed him the pizza
column7: and he responded by pushing the pizza back together and presenting to me what it was supposed to look like. I was expecting a yes when I asked for a new pizza since it cost $55 which is also just insane but #Hoboken and it's my birthday. At that point I just asked for my money back which they were nice enough to accommodate. This place was the best 3 or 4 years ago."

author: Rocco Walls
text: 'This place is very fine. The food they served was wonderful indeed.  I can honestly claim this restaurant was great.  The teams have been very welcoming. The restaurant is highly recommended!'

author: Jo Hayes
text: "Great pizza and service! I'm a thin crust hardcore but the Square pizza (I got with hot sausage and hot peppers) is DELISH. Super crunchy crust still and really great quality toppings. The pizza is also huge and leftovers heat up so well üòã\n\nThe tables are well spaced out and the heaters and covering keep you nice and warm! BYO also a great plus ü•Ç"

author: David Douglass
text: 'The Experience\n\nSince everyone had fled the NYC area for thanksgiving the cute outdoor seating was nicely empty. The heat lamps helped us pretend we weren‚Äôt eating outside in the winter and the BYOB policy allowed me to warm myself with copious amounts of red wine. The service wasn‚Äôt as good as the ambiance. We had to ask for utensils
column5: ask twice for water
column6:
and there was a snafu with the bill.

The Accoutrements

We got the ‚Äúnaked meatballs‚Äù which wasn‚Äôt an 80‚Äôs adult film but rather a sauceless appetizer. Instead of marinara
column7:
you got a hot pepper and ricotta on the side. The meatballs had a rich meaty flavor that stood on their own without the sauce. The pepper and ricotta added a fun dynamic. The pepper left this lasting tingle on the tongue which you could cool down with the ricotta. Overall a more interesting take on the normal saucy meatballs.

The Main Course

The pizza is in their name and so it had to be good. We got a classic pie with mushrooms
column8: pepperoni
column9: and arugula. The stand out topping was the pepperoni. This was not your bargain been cheapo roni this was top tier rounds of red flavor. Speaking of red
column10:
the sauce tasted so fresh I started looking around for the garden they picked the tomatoes from. Grab a pie here and you won‚Äôt be disappointed.

The Verdict

Realistically this is 3.5. The service was 3 stars if I‚Äôm being generous. However
column11: the atmosphere and food were a 4-star situation. Since I‚Äôm a glass half full guy I‚Äôll round up to 4 stars. Your waiters might not be attentive but your taste buds will appreciate your patience.'

author: Thomas Connolly
text: 'When picking up a pie from there
column5: they don‚Äôt give an estimated time to pick it up. Rather they say we‚Äôll text you when it‚Äôs ready. This is now the third time I‚Äôve waited til they texted me only to pick up a cold pizza. How about you figure out a better system.'

author: Ry D‚ÄôLessio
text: 'First and foremost
column5: THANK YOU for staying OPEN during the pandemic. Also for providing great eats to our healthcare workers! #hobokenSTRONG. YOU ARE GUYS AMAZING!'

author: Aliyah Huland El
text: 'I just was witness to absolute AWFUL customer service. A young man
column5: who happened to be black/African-American
column6: working for postmates walked in and was immediately accosted upon his arrival. When he communicated that he was there to place/pick up an order
column7: the man in charge rudely and loudly told this young man he was not to place an order with him
column8: so he shifted over to speak with a young woman at the register. When he began talking to her and showed his phone (my guess to show the order)
column9: the man then accused this young man of ‚Äútrespassing‚Äù and threatened to call the cops. It seemed so unwarranted
column11: as the young man was respectful and very clearly just doing his job. Kudos to the young man for handling the situation so well
column12: and shame on the man working!! I will NOT be supporting this restaurant going forward.'

author: Lisa Stone
text: "Amazing authentic Italian pizza and more.  I saw some of the reviews where people complained they thought the pizza was burnt... Not true.  This is authentic Italian pizza and comes out exactly as it should.   Also the Cacio and Pepe is amazing.  It‚Äôs as good as dishes I've eaten in Italy!!   Awesome place!!"

author: Mike Mariniello
text: 'Awesome pizza.  Quick and easy dial ahead and pick up'

author: Matthew Horesta
text: "The original pie is as good as Dave Portnoy says it is and worth the $27 price. It really is a superior pizza pie. My service experience was a disappointment. After learning that my order was given to another person with the same first name (not a big deal
column5: mistakes happen on a busy night)
column6: I waited another 40 minutes to get two pies. 40 minutes of standing of the curb while watching pies come out to table customers and take out is bad form. You make a mistake you should fix it ASAP. Upon getting home I find that one of the pies wasn't my original order. No acknowledgement of the inconvenience and I was still charged full price."

author: Chris Shimmin
text: 'Good pizza overall. I like the done crust! They don‚Äôt have online ordering.'

author: Gary Buckman
text: 'Drove 2 hours for this pizza and it was worth the wait. I recommend the classic.'

author: Dan Anderson
text: 'Went this past Saturday. Place was great. Service was perfect and the owner was a very nice and engaging guy. I gotta get the square next time i go

author: Ken Adams
text: 'Great food. And the pizza is legit. But
column5: it‚Äôs overpriced. A pie and one appetizer will cost around $50. There are a lot of comparable restaurants in Hoboken for 1/2 the price. That being said
column6: I‚Äôll still go back.'

author: Nikita Khripunov
text: 'Hands down the best square pie in New Jersey
column5: definitely would recommend.'

author: Anna Langella-Stanin
text: '$36.00 for a rubbery Grandma Pie. We were so excited but let down. It was decent but not worth the hefty price.'

author: Joshua Viel
text: 'Its the best food in the world...ever'

author: MaryAnn Massumi
text: 'Got the classic pizza and overall I would say it‚Äôs pretty decent. I prefer Napolis and Dozzino‚Äôs here in Hoboken but this is pretty close. I love that the crust and pizza is crispy without drying it out. I also loved the naked meatballs. The spices and pairing with ricotta and peppers is perfect!'

author: Howard Payne
text: 'Good pizza'

author: Nate King
text: 'The best Italian I‚Äôve ever had.'

author: Amanda Santiago
text: 'I am in disbelief by the altercation that occurred in this restaurant. We had a unbelievably rude waiter. From the second we got there the service was terrible
column5: the waiter doesn‚Äôt greet us doesn‚Äôt introduce himself just asks if we are ready to order 10 mins after being seated. But that wasn‚Äôt our issue
column6: after receiving our pizza my partner was in the midst of grabbing a slice and the waiter comes over and tells us ‚Äúthis isn‚Äôt your pizza‚Äù and snatches the pizza right out of his hands. Instead of apologizing for his actions he denies his approach while smart mouthing which escalated the situation. Had he been honest and respectful the outcome would have been different. I have never experienced that kind of service anywhere and will never spend my money here again. I hope the owner handles this situation accordingly.'

author: Maryel Balletta
text: 'Excellent square pizza!'

author: Nick Frangipane
text: 'Great pizza! I carried this all the way to Bayonne and it was still crunchy. Go to place in Hoboken'

author: Samantha Cosme
text: 'Wow . This pizza filled my soul with love'

author: Eric Hammer
text: "It's the best gourmet pizza in Hoboken and really should be kept in a different category for pizza. It's expensive
column5: $30 for a square pie I believe
column6:
but it's unlike any other pizza in the city.

I'd recommend one square pie per 3 people. Haven't had any of the round pies in my multiple visits but the squares have never disappointed.

Naked Meatballs were OUTSTANDING. From what i hear the pasta dishes are alright/good but can neither confirm nor deny. Typically I'll go with a group
column7: bring wine (it's BYOB which is amazing)
column8:
and order a couple square pies.

NOTE: ask for the garlic oil to add atop your pizza and gladly accept the fresh parm shred over the top

Something else I love about Tenth Street is how they'll call you when your food is ready for pickup. Very unusual but I'm a fan."

author: Terry Ahn
text: 'Shame
column5: great pizza. Horrible customer service. I ordered 2 sodas with my pizza
column6: both arrived warm. I called them to ask if I can get a refund and that they can come back and get the sodas if they want. The manager told me it\'s "obvious" they would be warm because they never refrigerate their sodas
column7: and I would know that if I ever ordered from them before. And I should\'ve asked for cold soda if I wanted it. Then she says I could easily put them in my fridge or use ice. Oh really? Is that how I make my drinks colder? Gee thanks. Not everyone has ice ready and I never had a pizza place deliver warm sodas before. They also forgot the garlic oil that comes with every pizza and I specifically asked for
column8: and rudely told me that\'s a courtesy so I shouldn\'t complain about it. I\'ve delivered food before so I\'m not about to make their driver come back to my 4th floor apartment to get me a cup of oil so I just hung up on them. Btw
column9: this is for a 46 dollar bill
column10: for 1 large pizza and 2 warm sodas lol. If you\'re gonna charge 6 dollars per topping
column11: at least have good customer service.'

author: The Keiretsu Foundation Ltd.
text: 'One of the Best things to spend $50 on
column5: with no regrets!‚ô°'

author: David Morton
text: 'The white pie is unbelievably delicious! Must try the naked meatballs with the long hot peppers and ricotta! Both were amazing!'

author: Lumarie David
text: 'Omg this pizza was worth the drive from the dough the cheese and pepperoni to the sauces is a Must !!!'

author: Devin Hendricks
text: 'The square pizza I ordered wasn\'t "well done
column5:
it was burnt to a crisp.'
Matthew Bombard, a year ago, 4, ''
Amanda Murphy, a year ago, 1, ''
Scott Cizenski, a year ago, 1, '$65 for 2 large pizzas, 1 cheese, 1 sausage peppers and onions, 6 dollars per topping. Called and tried to order small pizzas,they said they are only doing larges at the moment. Should have asked what the total was because the girl never told us over the phone. I paid 6 dollars for half of an onion. Ripping people off during a pandemic. Cheese pizza was real good.'
Dave Curran, a year ago, 2, Honestly
column6: the pizza is fine but our experiences have been far from good. We've been twice and service has been really sub-par.\n\nThe first time
column7: we ate there. We got served a cold pizza after watching our pizza sit on a counter for almost 15 minutes. No one noticed
column8: cared
column9: or ever checked on us once we got the pizza.\n\nSecond time was tonight as take out. We ordered at 6:10 pm
column10: they told us it would be about an hour to an hour and a half. We show up to pick it up and pay.  Everything is normal
column11: and then we watch order after order go out.  We asked about our food twice and it wasn't until after 8pm that they realized they never even cooked it. Finally got a pizza to take home at 8:30.\n\nI'm sure plenty of people have had good experiences because the food is fine but this place really needs to evaluate how it cares for its customers."

author: Landry Mcclure
text: 'This place is one of my favorites! Good pricing
column5: considerable dishes and the employees are constantly welcoming.'

author: nela bella
text: 'The best pizza'

author: Julie Soscia
text: 'My favorite local pizza spot and one of the best in Hoboken. Always welcoming vibes. Cozy up with a bottle of wine and the plain pizza!'

author: CallMeGooner
text:
"Place is amazing. Cute small resturant vibe with awesome food.

Because it is small it can get crowded and waits can be long but is worth it.

The square pie is one of the best pizzas I've ever had and you can feed 4-6 for 32 bucks. Can't beat it."

author: Lisa Dec
text: 'Lived in hoboken 20 years
column5: tried this place and it is horrible!  Got the order completely wrong and wouldn‚Äôt correct it once we got home and then we wee left to eat bland soggy pizza. Please there are sooo many better places in town for pizza. Save money cause it‚Äôs overpriced too!!!'

author: Carolyn Topp
text: 'There is a lot of good pizza in the area- this is the best
column5: along with the exceptional  meatballs & fantastic pasta!'

author: Sebastian Titze
text: 'Got here to order to go which takes about half an hour. While we were waiting
column5: we were rudely approached by a gentlemen coming in and telling us to leave until we receive a text message. If we don‚Äôt want to wait we could cancel our order. He double checked with us twice. He then explained that he is the owner and just got there. Very rude since we hadn‚Äôt been told we couldn‚Äôt wait inside before and would‚Äôve been okay if he had been more polite about it. This put a bad taste to the otherwise supposedly really good pizza.'

author: Andre Guadarrama
text: 'It was good
column5: but was a little overpriced. 34$ for a large pizza. There are many better places for cheaper. The staff was very nice though and the restaurant is very cool and quaint.'

author: R W
text: 'Edit:\nOrdered from here again and changed my review from 1 to 3 stars. The pizza was VERY good the second time. Although still dark
column5: the pizza was not burned (maybe they should consider cooking a bit less
column6: some pieces of crust were black
column7: but not the entire pizza like last time). The flavor of the crush
column8: sauce and cheese were well balanced
column9: and far ahead of the rest of Hoboken\'s offerings. The bottom has that leopard print that marks a perfect texture. Overall
column10: while I\'m still worried that it could come burned
column11:
I would order again. For each unburned order I will add another star to this review.

Previously:
The pizza came delivered completely burnt and inedible. Upon calling I was told "all of the pizzas come well done" and was completely disregarded. Poor quality food and poor quality service. The sauce and cheese were of good flavor. Too bad the crust was nearly incinerated.'

author: Waldi Jimenez
text: 'Just left this place 15 min ago... had their meatballs and their classic pizza with pepperoni. Meatballs were amazing and their Pizza even better!!! If I could give it more stars I would!!! Def come for amazing pizza! All pies are made well done! Owners were amazing too .'

author: Kevin Porter
text: 'Rude employees'

author: Zuhal Ta≈ü
text: 'The pizza was delicious; the crust
column5: the sauce üëåü§§ it was very well baked. I loved it! The owner of the place and the staff were very friendly and welcoming! Thank you for a good experience. üôè'

author: Matt Zagaja
text: "I really wanted to like this place. Came here twice. Unfortunately

column6: Mario
column7: makes you feel unwelcome
column8: almost to the point as if you're bothering him by even being there and even talks down to customers. Even if you're jam packed
column9: its easy to be professional and hospitable."

author: Rosemary Munoz
text: 'Love this pizza!!'

author: Chris O

author: Julian Hagmann
text: 'Great food and service. The pizza is one of

author: Sean Higgins

author: Alessandro Mannino
text: 'Clearly says everywhere that they close at 11pm

author: Nicholas Currie
text: "Urbano is the man and barstool was right (8.6) Best pizza I've ever had! They make everything in house and fresh"

text: "Great little place in the boken. Fresh ingredients

author: Michael John

author: Walter Cedeno

author: Andrei Trifonov
text: "Great place. Don't forget a bottle of wine! ;)"

author: steven revello
text: 'Best pizza in Hoboken.  A bit pricey.'

author: Matt Meyer
text: 'Favorite place in Hoboken with extremely friendly staff

column6: date night or group night out.'

author: Eleni Lazarides
text: 'THE BEST! Absolutely love this place. The service

author: Lilith Angsland
text:
'This place got a lot of hype from what I‚Äôve heard so I finally decided to try it.

-the atmosphere is amazing. Great staff and energy
-I ordered some pizza and the bottom was a little more burnt than I wanted it to be. Maybe it‚Äôs part of the flair of this place?
-pasta is NOT GOOD THERE.

I would go again for a quick slice if it‚Äôs not too crowded. And I would suggest people to at least try it. Maybe the pizza just wasn‚Äôt my style.'

author: A Scho
text: 'In the middle about this place.\n\nGreat atmosphere
column5: pizza is good
column6: but the Cacio e Pepe was the worst I‚Äôve ever had.\n\nEntirely too much black pepper it‚Äôs all you can taste. Otherwise
column7: noodles were bland and flavorless. When you‚Äôre working with salt on multiple levels- from the pasta
column8: boiled water
column10: it should have plenty of flavor. It seems as if they made up for that lack with the black pepper.\n\nIt‚Äôs a cute spot and will probably go back
column11: just not for the Cacio e Pepe though.'

author: Eric Bell
text: "*edit 9/24/2019. I've come back 2 times now after my initial 1 star review and I'm happy to say that they reverted back to their initial quality. I can't taste the pre-baking of the dough and it's crisp and fresh again. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great tasting
column5: slightly different (square) pizza.\n\nI use to love coming here and the square pizza was one of my favorites in Hoboken. That's until they started precooking all of the dough hours beforehand. This is absolutely indefensible. Just take a look back into the kitchen at the stack of cooked dough. I don't know a single pizza place that does this
column6: let alone charge 30 dollars for it.\n\nThe result is that the dough on the finished pizza once it sat around all day then cooked again with the toppings
column7: is that it's incredibly stale. The dough is both hard and soggy at the same time. After eating here multiple times
column8: I won't be back until this process is changed."

author: michael powers
text: "Great food and staff. We went there on the first nice night of the season. There was a wait to sit inside and outside wasn't set up yet. We asked if we could sit outside and within 3 minutes
column5: the area was set up for us.  The food was some of the best we have had in Hoboken.  We will definitely be return customers."

author: Jacqueline Dragoni
text: "Always fun to dine here and chat with Chris
column5: Maria and staff. We recently enjoyed the incredible homemade meatballs and rigatoni bolognese
column6: omg it was so delicious. We also had to have the sicilian pizza. Let's just say our meal disappeared fast!! Love the decor
column7: great vibe
column8: thanks Chris!"

author: Robert Lurie
text: "Easily one of the top 3 best pizza places in Hoboken
column5: and given how many pizza places there are here
column6: that's are hard list to compete on. Over the past few months
column7: they've expanded their menu
column8: which is a welcome addition as they started out with just 3 to 5 items.\n\nWhenever my wife and I are looking to order pizza
column9: this is our go-to. For dine in
column10: it's just as amazing. Such a cute atmosphere and it's BYOB! They use the freshest ingredients and the pizza is thin and crispy - so delicious. The square pizza really is incredible
column11: some of the best I've had. Square pizza usually suffers from being too dough-y and dry
column12: this is not the case.\n\nThe owners are also so friendly and really do care about their product. Highly recommend this place."

author: Colleen Robinson
text: 'Best pizza in Hoboken. Great summer spot'

text: 'Great meatball parm and pizza. But service is very slow but worth the wait.'

author: Jacob M

author: Mike Kerslake
text: 'I\'ve eaten a lot of pizza
column5: from a lot of different locations in my life. It\'s quite possibly the most important thing in my life
column6: next to family. That said. This place has made it to my top ten list
column7: for sure. From the moment I came in
column8: I knew I was going to fall in love because at the top of the menu it read "all pie\'s come well done". I came here on a date and we split a large Margherita pie. It was absolutely
column9: exceptional. If I wasn\'t so keen on not looking like a slob
column10: I would of ordered a second pie to take home for second dinner. They\'re BYOB so definitely bring yourself a nice bottle of wine or a 6 pack of something hoppy (if that\'s your jam). It\'s a bit small
column11: but it\'s cozy. Staff was super friendly and accommodating. Definitely

text: 'Great staff and the ‚ÄúSquare‚Äù pizza with house mozzarella was awesome. Had the rare pizza balance of crunchy and soft. If you get the chance I highly recommend it.'

text: 'I‚Äôve gone now for over a year and can say that it‚Äôs always been delicious

column6: but I can say that each and every time it‚Äôs been better and better with plenty of improvement. The service is always great
column7: you feel like at home
column8: and the food does not disappoint. Hoboken has plenty of Italian/Pizza Restaurants
column9: but this is by far one of the best. To add on

author: Carolyn Delia
text: 'This place is amazing. The chef has been making us rigatoni with vegetables
column5: like a primavera. Blows me away every time. I hope they add it to their menu. Fridays are our pizza night and tenth St is becoming our go to!'

author: Evan Boyle
text: '10th Street opened up in our neighborhood and my wife & I have been meaning to go for months. We went for the first time tonight & will definitely be back. The food was spectacular and it can be argued that it has the best pizza in Hoboken (definitely gives Napoli‚Äôs and Johnny Pepperoni a run for their money). There‚Äôs 2 reasons I‚Äôm not giving it 5 stars: 1) The water situation is weird. It‚Äôs self-serve
column5: so you have to get up for water everytime you want more. 2) It‚Äôs a bit pricey for a BYOB place. Other than that
column6: this place is great & I highly recommend it.'

author: Frank Pugh
text: 'Close if not the best pizza in Hoboken.  The service is always fantastic.  You must try the peppers and the red pepper garlic olive oil.  Out of this world!!!'

text: 'Ordered a square pizza. Half pepperoni half plain. The pizza looked good and smelled good. Ingredients tasted fresh. The texture of the pizza NOT good. It was spongy and hard to take a bite. Bad.  30$ pizza should have a different outcome.'

author: John Pagano
text: "Tenth Street Pasta & Pizza had great pizza and salad. It's a pricy BYOB
column5: but the food was truly great. Make sure to top your pizza with the red pepper and garlic infused olive oil! Front of the house was a litte cold to start (no wait estimate & sat at the bar without being asked for a preference). Ultimately
column6: I'm happy with the experience
column7: but I was treated as if this wasn't my first time here. If ordering take-out
column8: order by phone as they've mentioned logistics issues with other methods."

author: Thomas DiPaolo
text: "Mario is a great guy. We walked in
column5: in the rain
column6: with 2 hangry kids

column8: he let us stay even though we threw him a curve and gave him an extra thing to worry about before his dinner service. We'll definitely be back
